title: Children's Halloween cake topper appears to say word that is ruder than intended
text:
A photo showing a Halloween cake decorated with what appears to be a very rude word is going viral on social media.

The snap - which is believed to have been taken by an American - was anonymously uploaded to an Australian cake shaming Facebook page and it was meant to read 'Trick or Treat'.

The problem is the script of the topper isn't properly spaced, which makes the word 'Trick' look as if it could be a swear word.

'The person who made this said it's supposed to say "Trick or Treat",' the person sharing it captioned the post.

A children's Halloween cake (pictured) features a decoration that's meant to read 'Trick or Treat' but looks as if it could be interpreted as a very rude word

They then added an edit: 'Some of y'all, aren't understand (sic) the reason this cake is on here. 'Yes, the cake is beautiful. However, focus on the font!'

The cake's topper swiftly caused social media to go wild, with the post receiving over 1,000 reactions and scores of comments.

Many agreed that the decoration did look like a swear word.

'Absolutely love it, the f-word makes it better,' said one commenter.

Another added: 'The R is deff way too close to the T making the cursive T resemble an F. Still a beautiful cake, just toss out the topper.'

A third said they thought the cake was stunning regardless of the fact they thought the topper said 'f off'.

Halloween is celebrated October 31, a night where kids hit the streets in costumes 'trick or treating' neighbours and friends (stock image)

'Scrolling through I thought it said 'f off then realised it's supposed to say trick or treat. Beautiful cake, too bad they ran out of time to proofread the topper.'

A few commenting on the post said there was a chance the topper may have been an intentional Halloween trick.

'That's the best damned Trick or Treat I've ever seen!,' said one.

'10/10 I love this cake for all the reasons it is a fail.'
description: A photo of a children's Halloween cake topped with what appears to be a very rude word has the internet in stitches. The decoration is meant to read 'Trick or Treat' but looks like something else.
authors: Emilia Mazza For Daily Mail Australia
